title: I don't get it tho, how is this not deserving an S- or S?
body: How does the system work? I have such a perfect KDA with normal kinda of dmg dealt and taken, and I still don't get an S-. Rito, wut do expect more from me as a jgler. The same amount of cs as laner? Give me a FKN EXPLANATION TO THIS! I'm so sick and tired of this shit.{{summoner:14}} {{item:3025}} {{champion:64}} {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: Also if your playing a champion like lee sin, it's not good enough to do good, you have to do perfect.
aim for 20+/0 300 cs and many many wards placed and you might get an a+ http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/049/778/e53.gif

Its very dependant on what the average score of that champion is, someone like Lee Sin _(who everyone plays)_ will need an amazing score to get S, because there are so many people that play him so well. 

Where as harder champs that few people play, are easier to get S's on.

For example, here is an atrocious Azir game I had, I played awful and didn't deserve the win, we got carried by Lulu all game:

http://imgur.com/a/CCIio

I still got S- because no one plays Azir, and when people do try, they bomb out because he is hard. So his average score is far less impressive that Lee Sin's _(at least atm)_, therefore it takes less to get an S.

But stick at it, I'm sure you will get your S soon enough. :)
CS has a huge part to do with it from what I've found.
its also effected by the role you take them in.
that explains my S's with yorick, tristana, sion, nami, veigar, anivia, viktor ,(and if i owned him) yas (probably more champs im forgetting :D)
Mastery level 5 is no bad thing to stop at considering you need  blue essence etc to advance.

Greetings OMG Spectre,

Currently Riot has not revealed a lot of information as to how the mastery system works. This is because the first thing that they want people to focus on is winning the game, as opposed to farming for certain things that get them a higher mastery score. However this is what they have said about the mastery system:

> #What is in the champ mastery grades formula?

>The grades you receive are driven by how you rank against all other players in your region who also played your champion and position across various performance categories. We don’t reveal the exact formula so that it can’t be min-maxed as we really want to avoid incentivizing playing for stats like CS or K/D/A rather than playing to win. However, the variables are fairly intuitive in terms of what you would expect to be important to winning.

> -Riot Socrates, Lead Game Designer

With this in mind since the system ranks you against other players that play your champion in various performance categories we know that if you play a champion that is very popular such as Yasuo, it might be harder to get an S rank because of the amount of people setting the bar for that performance rating.

---

With this in mind the best thing that you can do to try and get an S rank on a champion that you want to get that level 7 mastery is constantly be improving. If you feel like you should have gotten an S when you shouldn't have, look for a section of your gameplay you could have done better in your game to improve yourself. There must be something there that you could improve on to help you get that S rank.

---

I hope that this helps give a bit more clarity and info about how the mastery system works. If you have any more questions or there is any other way I can help let me know. Good luck in your games and good luck getting those S ranks.

~Elam
